children.name: Research Interests
text: I am currently writing a thesis about automated reasoning in the scope of formal program verification. Priorly, I have been building tools for automatically debugging power and performance issues for the Android platform while working at Intel's Strategic CAD Labs. Even earlier, I have worked on optimizing compilers, applying machine learning for automatically tuning compiler optimizations and designing new, scalable optimizations for an explicitely parallel host architecture.

children.name: Verification Debigging
text: In modular verification, the development workflow consists of
(1) writing and debugging the implementation and the specification for each procedure
and (2) constructing a formal proof that this implementation adheres to its specification.
The latter problem is addressed by modern program verifiers that automate the workflow
and dramatically reduce the burden of constructing formal proofs manually.
However, writing sound and complete specifications is an inherently hard mathematical problem
that requires deep interaction between the programmer and the verifier.
This interaction should be naturally supported by the IDE.

children.name: Projects
text: I am a member of the Viper project, developing an intermediate language and the infrastructure for formal deductive verification. My main focus is on extending Viper's specification features with advanced properties: heap reachability, comprehensions, etc. I am currently the main developer of Viper~IDE.
